content.description: Sit start on a large block just to the right of the slab. Mantel up into a thin crack. Traverse the crack out right until just before the huge divot in the wall, and then climb up.
content.location: This is in the center of the Shipwreck Crag. The starting hold is just to the right of the slab.

content.description: This starts on some nice holds at chest height in the middle of the crag and climbs straight up, meeting with the final part of the Shipwreck Traverse.
content.location: This is towards the right side of the Crag, starting approximately five feet to the right of the start of the Shipwreck Traverse

content.description: Sit start on a juggy block, and then using a one-and-a-half finger pocket, move straight up to a comfortable topout.
content.location: This is on the far left of the Shipwreck Crag.

content.description: Stand start on the large, juggy, horizontal crack, and work straight up.
content.location: This is on the approximately 8 foot tall section on the left side of crag to the right of The Octopus and The Kraken.

content.description: Sit start on the juggy block, and then using the one-and-a-half finger pocket and some tough crimps, move out right to top out. The foot holds are great, but the hand holds are tough.
content.location: This is on the far left of the Shipwreck Crag.

content.description: This is a precarious slab climb. Start in the middle of the slab on great feet, and then climb up and slightly right using small cobbles and divots in the wall.
content.location: This slab is in the middle of the crag on the left side of the taller section of the wall.

content.description: Sit start matched on a small crimp. Work up and slightly to the right on good holds. Avoid the big divot in the middle of the wall. Climb through the middle of the bulge at the top of the wall. The two cruxes are pulling off the start and climbing through the middle of the bulge.
content.location: This is on the right side of the Shipwreck Crag. Start three feet right of Shipwreck Direct, and then climb up and a bit to the right.

content.description: The Shipwreck Crag is an approximately 30 foot long wall of conglomerate puddingstone. It can be broken into three sections: an approximately 8 foot high wall on the left, an approximately 15 foot high slab in the middle, and an approximately 15 foot high wall on the right. There are some good quality boulder problems in the low-to-moderate range on each of these sections. The crag is fairly secluded, getting little foot traffic, and aside from the sound of the T running about 200 feet behind you every few minutes, it is relatively quiet.
